text.section: In this section, "Program" means the Maryland Meals for Achievement In-Classroom Breakfast Program.

section.section: There is a school breakfast program in the State, known as the Maryland Meals for Achievement In-Classroom Breakfast Program.
The Program is a joint effort of the Department and the county boards or sponsoring agencies for eligible nonpublic schools.
The purpose of the Program is to provide funding for a school that makes an in-classroom breakfast available to all students in the school.
The funding is intended to complement the funding received by a school from the federal government for a school breakfast program.

text.section:
A county board or a sponsoring agency for an eligible nonpublic school shall:
Apply to the Department for funds for schools within the jurisdiction of the board or for schools that are under the sponsoring agency that:
Are eligible to participate in the Program; and
Apply to the board or to the sponsoring agency to participate in the Program; and
Submit an annual report to the Department on the Program, including the manner in which the funds have been expended.

The employee organization that is the exclusive representative of the certificated public school employees of a county board and the employee organization that is the exclusive representative of the noncertificated employees of a county board and the county board shall negotiate the terms of the participation of the employees in the Program.
